items.sentence: Isn\'t it strange that Tom isn\'t here by now?
The teacher asked Tom to read his essay aloud.
I\'ve never told this story to anybody before.
If I can\'t trust my parents, who can I trust?
Tom excels both academically and athletically.
I\'ll get over this with or without your help.
I\'ll never be able to do that as well as you.
Tom owns a lot of land just outside of Boston.
That\'s the stupidest thing you\'ve ever done.
She asked him to stay, but he didn\'t want to.
She got over the shock of her father\'s death.
Tom may have said that, but I don\'t think so.
My computer crashed and now it won\'t boot up.
Tom is my neighbor, but I hardly ever see him.
What about Tom? Shouldn\'t we invite him, too?
Do you believe that there\'s life after death?
Tom asked me why I was wearing a coat and tie.
Tom ate many of his meals off of paper plates.
Tom didn\'t know what Mary was supposed to do.
Tom didn\'t know whether Mary was safe or not.
Tom said he\'d rather not ask Mary to do that.
According to Tom, you weren\'t in class today.
All four of Tom\'s grandparents were teachers.
Tom isn\'t just my boss. He\'s my friend, too.
I sure hope Tom does what he said he would do.
I sure wish I could remember what Tom told me.
I suspect Tom and Mary are anxious to do that.
I suspect Tom and Mary have to leave tomorrow.
Tom is hesitant to visit Mary in the hospital.
Tom is in the process of doing that right now.
Tom is just a large fish in a very small pond.
Tom knew immediately that something was wrong.
Tom knew it was Mary who had written the note.
Tom knew it was wrong to do what he was doing.
Tom knew that something terrible had happened.
Tom didn\'t make enough brownies for everyone.
Tom didn\'t quite understand what Mary wanted.
Tom didn\'t seem very surprised Mary did that.
Tom didn\'t think he was good enough for Mary.
I\'m pretty certain that Tom is in Boston now.
I\'m still not entirely comfortable with this.
I\'m sure Tom will return my calls eventually.
I\'m very impressed with your quality control.
What museums would you recommend that I visit?
What on earth makes you think you can fool me?
What sport do you think is the most dangerous?
Am I the only one who doesn\'t agree with you?
Tom doesn\'t know why Mary wants him to leave.
I can\'t give any more of an answer than that.
I can\'t stop thinking about the stolen money.
